meanings.definition: Wash (something) before the main wash in a washing machine.
meanings.sent1: Before starting the laundry, remember to prewash the stained clothes.
meanings.sent2: I always prewash my delicate garments to avoid any damage in the main wash.
meanings.sent3: The socks decided to prewash themselves by jumping into the sink before laundry day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to prewash away all the worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain acted as nature's way to prewash the dusty leaves of the plants.

meanings.sent1: The prewash setting on the washing machine helps in removing tough stains.
meanings.sent2: The prewash is essential for heavily soiled clothes to ensure a thorough cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics turned the prewash into a bubbly mess in the laundry room.
meanings.sent4: The prewash of dawn painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The prewash of the river before the waterfall made the water look crystal clear.
